alert.note: Alert for Oswego (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 10:13AM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...Drenching thunderstorms will impact portions of Oswego County through 1115 AM EDT... At 1010 AM EDT, Doppler radar continued to display an axis of heavy rain and embedded thunderstorm activity extending from near Pulaski to near Brewerton. Movement of the line was nearly stationary to moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sandy Island Beach State Park, Pulaski, Central Square, Redfield, Selkirk Shores State Park, Mexico Point State Park, Hastings, Richland, Constantia, West Monroe, Mexico, Williamstown, Orwell, Sandy Creek, Cleveland, Lacona, Parish, Altmar, and Amboy Center. This includes Interstate 81 between exits 32 and 37. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Over an inch of rain has fallen in parts of southern Oswego county, including an inch and a half in Central Square. An additional inch of rain will be possible for parts of the county. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
